source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_SEQ_00<tab>Haldbroda has a suggestion for the kind adventurer who came bearing foreman Ahtbyrm's message.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_SEQ_00<tab>Haldbroda aimerait vous demander de l'aide pour retrouver l'ouvrier disparu.

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_SEQ_01<tab>According to Haldbroda, there still may be survivors from the recent accident washed up on the Salt Strand. One of them may even be the missing shipwright, Fyrilsmyd.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_SEQ_01<tab>Haldbroda vous a expliqué que Fyrilsmyd pourrait se trouver quelque part aux atolls de sel. Allez à cet endroit et cherchez l'ouvrier disparu.

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_SEQ_02<tab>As if by some miracle, you find Fyrilsmyd alive and well on the Salt Strand. The shipwrecked shipwright, however, reveals to you that he cannot return to the Moraby Drydocks without first collecting the three pieces of cargo he was originally sent to collect─the cargo that is now guarded by deadly Qiqirn beachcombers.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_SEQ_02<tab>Fyrilsmyd vous a expliqué qu'il ne pourrait pas rentrer au chantier naval de Moraby avant d'avoir retrouvé les pièces destinées au Victoire. Cherchez dans les atolls de sel et aidez-le à mettre la main sur la barre à roue, le cordage et la voilure.

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_SEQ_03<tab>You have salvaged all three missing pieces of cargo. Deliver them to Fyrilsmyd right away.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_SEQ_03<tab>Vous avez récupéré toutes les pièces pour le Victoire. Remettez-les à Fyrilsmyd.

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_SEQ_04<tab>Fyrilsmyd thanks you for locating the cargo, and asks of you one last favor before running off once again─return to Ahtbyrm at the Moraby Drydocks, and tell the foreman what has become of his shipwright.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_SEQ_04<tab>Retournez au chantier naval de Moraby et rassurez Ahtbyrm sur le sort de Fyrilsmyd.

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_SEQ_05<tab>Ahtbyrm seems pleased that both cargo and wright were discovered no worse for wear. Contrary to what Fyrilsmyd reports, the foreman does not believe that the storm which caused the ships to sink was natural, but in fact created by the Sahagin.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_SEQ_05<tab>Ahtbyrm s'est réjoui de savoir Fyrilsmyd sain et sauf. Il se demande toutefois si l'accident du bac ne serait pas en fait un coup des pirates.

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_TODO_00<tab>Search the Salt Strand for survivors.

target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_TODO_01<tab>Retrouver la barre à roue du Victoire

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_TODO_04<tab>Take the three items to Fyrilsmyd.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_TODO_04<tab>Donner les pièces du Victoire à Fyrilsmyd

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_HALDBRODA_000_1<tab>Now, the way I see it, if you have time to be standing here questioning my character, then you most certainly have the time to get that arse of yours down to the Salt Strand and help us search for survivors of the wreck.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_HALDBRODA_000_1<tab>Dis, tu ne voudrais pas nous aider dans nos recherches<var 1D /var>? On manque justement de gens pour retrouver cet ouvrier.

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_HALDBRODA_000_2<tab>Who knows? You may just run across this Fyrilsmyd everyone seems so eager to find. Here's to hoping the Navigator hasn't found him first.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_HALDBRODA_000_2<tab>Nous nous concentrons sur les zones en mer. J'aimerais donc te demander de regarder du côté des atolls de sel. Fyrilsmyd y a peut-être trouvé refuge.

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_10<tab>Aye, I'm Fyrilsmyd. Ye say the foreman's wonderin' on me whereabouts? I thought he might be. But ye must know, I cannot show me face at the Drydocks until I've righted the terrible wrong I caused.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_10<tab>Je suis bien Fyrilsmyd, en effet. Et vous...<var 1D /var>? Ahtbyrm vous a envoyé<var 08 E905 ((e)) (()) /var> à ma recherche, vous dites<var 1D /var>?

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_11<tab>Two nights past, I made the trip from the Drydocks to Candlekeep Quay, just as the foreman asked. The seas were right rough, and the cap'n of the cargo ship was wary of bringin' her too close to the cliffs, so I paid a few coins to a fisher to take me out to meet her.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_11<tab>Mal<var 16 /var>heu<var 16 /var>reu<var 16 /var>se<var 16 /var>ment, je ne peux pas rentrer avant d'avoir récupéré les pièces destinées au Victoire... Elles sont passées par-dessus bord lorsque le bac a été heurté par un navire, vous voyez.

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_12<tab>By the time we was halfway 'twixt shore and ship, the swells had risen to nigh on ten yalms, and 'twasn't long afore the waves had hold of us. Try as we might to steady the boat, nature's grip was too tight, and we was flung headlong into the Lominsan galley.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_12<tab>J'ai im<var 16 /var>mé<var 16 /var>dia<var 16 /var>te<var 16 /var>ment plongé pour les récupérer, mais je n'ai pas pu les retrouver... et je n'ose pas trop m'aventurer n'importe où avec les créatures dangereuses qui rôdent dans le coin. Vous ne voudriez pas m'aider<var 1D /var>?

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_13<tab>When I awoke, both ships were gone, and the cargo I was to collect lay strewn across the Salt Strand. I's made every effort to salvage it, but the sands are crawlin' with Qiqirn, and I ain't a one with a sword. And now ye see why it is I cannot return to the Drydocks...
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_13<tab>Il s'agit de la barre à roue, du cordage et de la voilure du Victoire. Rapportez-les-moi si jamais vous mettez la main dessus, s'il vous plaît... Ah, soyez prudent<var 08 E905 ((e)) (()) /var>, il y a des Qiqirns par ici, et j'ai découvert à mes frais qu'ils ne sont pas très amicaux.

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_AHTBYRM_000_20<tab>I am relieved to hear that both Fyrilsmyd and the supplies are unharmed, though it was foolish for him to believe that I would blame him for that which was obviously out of his hands.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_AHTBYRM_000_20<tab>Ah, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. Te revoilà enfin<var 1D /var>! Sais-tu ce qui est arrivé à Fyrilsmyd...<var 1D /var>? Une collision avec un navire...<var 1D /var>!? Ça ressemble beaucoup à une ruse de pirates pour voler la cargaison du bac sans être soupçonnés...

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_AHTBYRM_000_21<tab>You see, there was no storm that day, and the seas here adjacent the Drydocks were as calm as a slumbering child. This leads me to believe that the trouble the ships encountered off Candlekeep Quay was of a less natural sort─the sort which the Sahagin have been known to conjure.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_AHTBYRM_000_21<tab>Enfin, le plus important, c'est qu'il soit sain et sauf. Les Dieux soient loués, nous allons pouvoir continuer la con<var 16 /var>struc<var 16 /var>tion du Victoire. Merci de t'être donné toute cette peine, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_30<tab>That night, I was tossed into the sea like some doll of rags, and it weren't long afore the world 'round me faded to black as I slipped deeper into the abyss. But lo, the Navigator wouldn't see me to the gates of the seven hells, and I woke to find meself washed ashore. And here I's been, ever since, waitin' for a chance to salvage me master's cargo.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_30<tab>Mince... Si je rentre au chantier naval sans la barre à roue, le cordage et la voilure pour le Victoire, Ahtbyrm va me tomber dessus comme la misère sur le pauvre monde...

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_31<tab>The missin' parts! I-I don't know how I can repay you!
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_31<tab>Vous avez tout retrouvé<var 1D /var>!? Vous n'avez pas idée du pétrin dont vous me sortez<var 1D /var>! Merci, merci infiniment<var 1D /var>!

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_32<tab>I'll deliver the supplies right away...but first I must stop by the Quay so that I might pay me respects to the widow of the brave fisher who gave his life fer a handful o' coin.
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_32<tab>Je vais rassurer les marins du quai de la Torche pour qu'ils arrêtent de me chercher en mer. Vous pourriez dire à Ahtbyrm que je ne vais pas tarder à retourner au chantier naval<var 1D /var>?

source: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_33<tab>Could ye tell Ahtbyrm that I'll be back at the Drydocks by <var 08 E3E90C0D ((<var 08 E3E90C05 ((daybreak)) ((nightfall)) /var>)) ((<var 08 E3E90C12 ((nightfall)) ((daybreak)) /var>)) /var>? Many thanks, adventurer! I will not forget this kindness!
target: TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_FYRILSMYD_000_33<tab>Cela devrait le réjouir de savoir que les pièces destinées au Victoire ne sont pas perdues... et peut-être aussi que je suis sain et sauf, sait-on jamais. Hé hé hé.
TEXT_SUBSEA118_00415_SYSTEM_000_40<tab>Un Qiqirn dénicheur d'œufs vous a repéré<var 08 E905 ((e)) (()) /var><var 1D /var>!
